item.title: Falcon 9 Milestones Vindicate SpaceX’s ‘Dumb’ Approach to Reuse
item.description: The workhorse rocket has continued its streak of success.

item.title: Scientists Are Flocking to Bluesky
item.description: Academics once loved Twitter—but in the age of X they’ve abandoned it in droves.

item.title: Scientists Are Flocking to Bluesky
item.description: Academics once loved Twitter—but in the age of X they’ve abandoned it in droves.

item.title: Arkansas Hosts the Planet’s Only Public Diamond Mine
item.description: Visitors have unearthed over 35,000 diamonds at Crater of Diamonds State Park since 1972.

item.title: Arkansas Hosts the Planet’s Only Public Diamond Mine
item.description: Visitors have unearthed over 35,000 diamonds at Crater of Diamonds State Park since 1972.

item.title: How One Wikipedia Editor Unraveled the ‘Single Largest Self-Promotion Operation’ in the Site's History
item.description: A decade-long effort to boost one man’s reputation was undone in a matter of weeks.

item.title: How One Wikipedia Editor Unraveled the ‘Single Largest Self-Promotion Operation’ in the Site's History
item.description: A decade-long effort to boost one man’s reputation was undone in a matter of weeks.

item.title: Why You Can’t Trust a Chatbot to Talk About Itself
item.description: Anytime you expect AI to be self-aware, you’re in for disappointment. That’s just not how it works.

item.title: Why You Can’t Trust a Chatbot to Talk About Itself
item.description: Anytime you expect AI to be self-aware, you’re in for disappointment. That’s just not how it works.

item.title: AOL Will Shut Down Dial-Up Internet Access in September
item.description: The move will pinch users in rural or remote areas not yet served by broadband infrastructure or satellite internet. Around 175,000 households still use dial-up internet in the US.

item.title: AOL Will Shut Down Dial-Up Internet Access in September
item.description: The move will pinch users in rural or remote areas not yet served by broadband infrastructure or satellite internet. Around 175,000 households still use dial-up internet in the US.

item.title: Peacock Feathers Are Stunning. They Can Also Emit Laser Beams
item.description: Scientists hope their plumage project could someday lead to biocompatible lasers that could safely be embedded in the human body.

item.title: Peacock Feathers Are Stunning. They Can Also Emit Laser Beams
item.description: Scientists hope their plumage project could someday lead to biocompatible lasers that could safely be embedded in the human body.

item.title: Still Using Windows 10? Here's How to Get Another Year of Updates for Free
item.description: If you’re not ready to upgrade, you can still get security updates until October 2026 by enrolling in Microsoft’s ESU program.

item.title: Still Using Windows 10? Here's How to Get Another Year of Updates for Free
item.description: If you’re not ready to upgrade, you can still get security updates until October 2026 by enrolling in Microsoft’s ESU program.

item.title: A Secretive US Space Plane Will Soon Test Quantum Navigation Technology
item.description: The space plane’s test flight will advance development of a new navigation technology based on electromagnetic wave interference.

item.title: A Secretive US Space Plane Will Soon Test Quantum Navigation Technology
item.description: The space plane’s test flight will advance development of a new navigation technology based on electromagnetic wave interference.

item.title: A Top NASA Official Is Among Thousands of Staff Leaving the Agency
item.description: Makenzie Lystrup’s departure from NASA’s Goddard Space Flight Center comes soon after the resignation of the director of JPL.

item.title: A Top NASA Official Is Among Thousands of Staff Leaving the Agency
item.description: Makenzie Lystrup’s departure from NASA’s Goddard Space Flight Center comes soon after the resignation of the director of JPL.

item.title: Italian YouTuber Faces Jail Time for Showing Android Handhelds With Emulated Games
item.description: The games on the devices shown by the content creator may not be entirely legal. That was enough for Italian law enforcement to ding him for “promotion of pirated copyrighted materials.”

item.title: Italian YouTuber Faces Jail Time for Showing Android Handhelds With Emulated Games
item.description: The games on the devices shown by the content creator may not be entirely legal. That was enough for Italian law enforcement to ding him for “promotion of pirated copyrighted materials.”

item.title: Hackers Are Finding New Ways to Hide Malware in DNS Records
item.description: Newly published research shows that the domain name system—a fundamental part of the web—can be exploited to hide malicious code and prompt injection attacks against chatbots.
